content.json: # Azure Monitor Starter Packs - Extended Admin Centre - V2.1

## General Parameters

### Subscriptions

Select the Subscriptions that will be used in the Configuration

### Logic App

Select the logic app to be used. Typically the shoulbe a single one but if more instances exist, select the one for the instance you want to use.

### Function Apps

Select the Backend Function to be used. Typically the shoulbe a single one but if more instances exist, select the one for the instance you want to use.

### Config Function Key

This field will be automatically populated once the function is selected.

### Workspace

Select the Log Analytics Workspace to be used for this instance.

### Azure Managed Grafana

Select the Azure Managed Grafana if you have deployed one along with the solution.

parameters.name: logicAppResource
parameters.label: Logic App
parameters.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.logic/workflows" 
| where isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacksComponents)
| project Id=id, Name=name

parameters.name: FunctionApps
parameters.label: Function Apps
parameters.description: Select the function to provide the access key.
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.web/sites' and ['kind'] =~ 'functionapp'
| where isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacksComponents)
| project id,name

parameters.name: configKey
parameters.label: Config Function Key
parameters.description: The function key is fetched automatically from the function selected on the right.

parameters.name: GrafanaInstance
parameters.label: Azure Managed Grafana
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ "microsoft.dashboard/grafana"
| where isnotempty(tags.monitorStarterPacksComponents) or isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacksComponents)
| project id, label=properties.endpoint

parameters.name: PaaSQuery
parameters.description: This parameter is used to bring the proper PaaS list of supported services.

parameters.name: PlatformQuery
parameters.description: This parameter is used to bring the proper Platform list of supported services.

parameters.name: appInsightsName
parameters.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/components"
| where name == "{FunctionApps:name}"
| project id, name

content.query:
resources
| where isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacks) or isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacksComponents)
|union ( 
policyresources | where isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks))
| summarize count() by type
| sort by count_ desc
content.title: Monitoring Packs resources and Components

content.query: {"version":"CustomEndpoint/1.0","data":null,"headers":[{"key":"x-functions-key","value":"{configKey}"}],"method":"GET","url":"https://{FunctionApps:name}.azurewebsites.net/api/config?Action=getAllServiceTags","contentType":"text/plain","urlParams":[{"key":"","value":""}],"transformers":null}

{"version":"CustomEndpoint/1.0","data":null,"headers":[{"key":"x-functions-key","value":"{configKey}"}],"method":"GET","url":"https://{FunctionApps:name}.azurewebsites.net/api/config?Action=getAllServiceTags","contentType":"text/plain","urlParams":[{"key":"","value":""}],"transformers":null}

content.json:
# Getting Started

Welcome to the Azure Monitoring Packs. This workbook was designed to help you configuring the solution. Here you can:
- Enable/Disable monitoring packs for one or more VMs or services. You may also disable all the monitoring for a specific server or service. This will remove the tags and the rule associations. For services, right now, the alerts wonÂ´t be deleted by themselves.
- Enable/Disable Alerts in bulk. You can also assign a different Action group to one or more alerts or delete the rules**
- Check policy status and start remediation if required. By clicking in a policy, you can also assign that policy to another scope.
- Check Monitor pack associations.
- Review discovered applications (VMs only)
- Manage agent configuration (install/remove)

## Link to your managed [Grafana]({GrafanaInstance:label}) instance. Make sure to property set permissions before attemping to access it.

## ***If this is the first time using this solution, please configure parameters in the Configuration tab and save the workbook for proper functionality.***


## Please check the Monitoring Packs repository for updates. [Azure MONitor STARter Packs](http://github.com/Azure/AzureMonitorStarterPacks)
## Also check the Azure Monitor Baseline Alerts ([AMBA](http://aka.ms/amba)) website for the details on the alerts.

## IaaS Information

The summary below shows details related to the IaaS Monitoring packs.

content.query:
resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines' or type =~ 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines'
| extend MonitorStatus=iff(isnotempty(tostring(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)),'Monitored','Not Monitored')
| summarize count() by MonitorStatus
content.title: Monitoring Status (Tags)

content.query:
Resources
| where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines'
| extend
    JoinID = toupper(id)
| join kind=leftouter(
    Resources
    | where ( type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions') and name in ('AzureMonitorLinuxAgent', 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent')
    | extend
        VMId = toupper(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions'))),
        ExtensionName = name
) on $left.JoinID == $right.VMId
| union (Resources
| where type == 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend
    JoinID = toupper(id)
| join kind=leftouter(
    Resources
    | where type == 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions' and name in ('AzureMonitorLinuxAgent', 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent')
    | extend
        VMId = toupper(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions'))),
        ExtensionName = name
) on $left.JoinID == $right.VMId)
| summarize count() by AgentInstalled=iff(isempty(ExtensionName),"No","Yes")
content.title: Agent Install Status

content.query:
policyresources | where type == "microsoft.policyinsights/policystates" | extend policyName=tostring(properties.policyDefinitionName), complianceState=properties.complianceState
| join (policyresources | where type == "microsoft.authorization/policydefinitions" and isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks) | project policyId=id, policyName=name, pack=tostring(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)) on policyName
| project policyId, policyName, complianceState=tostring(complianceState), pack,type='Policy'
| union( policyresources
| where type =~ 'Microsoft.PolicyInsights/PolicyStates'
| extend complianceState = tostring(properties.complianceState)
| extend
	resourceId = tostring(properties.resourceId),
	policyAssignmentId = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentId),
	policyAssignmentScope = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentScope),
	policyAssignmentName = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentName),
	policyDefinitionId = tostring(properties.policyDefinitionId),
    policySetDefinitionId=tostring(properties.policySetDefinitionId),
	policyDefinitionReferenceId = tostring(properties.policyDefinitionReferenceId),
	stateWeight = iff(complianceState == 'NonCompliant', int(300), iff(complianceState == 'Compliant', int(200), iff(complianceState == 'Conflict', int(100), iff(complianceState == 'Exempt', int(50), int(0)))))
| summarize max(stateWeight) by resourceId, policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| summarize counts = count() by policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, max_stateWeight, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| summarize overallStateWeight = max(max_stateWeight),
nonCompliantCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 300),
compliantCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 200),
conflictCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 100),
exemptCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 50) by policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| extend totalResources = todouble(nonCompliantCount + compliantCount + conflictCount + exemptCount)
| extend compliancePercentage = iff(totalResources == 0, todouble(100), 100 * todouble(compliantCount + exemptCount) / totalResources)
| project policyAssignmentName, scope = policyAssignmentScope,policySetDefinitionId,
complianceState = iff(overallStateWeight == 300, 'nonCompliant', iff(overallStateWeight == 200, 'Compliant', iff(overallStateWeight == 100, 'conflict', iff(overallStateWeight == 50, 'exempt', 'notstarted')))),
compliancePercentage,
compliantCount,
nonCompliantCount,
conflictCount,
exemptCount
| where isnotempty(policySetDefinitionId)
| join (policyresources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.authorization/policysetdefinitions' and isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)
| extend policySetDefinitionId=tostring(id)) on policySetDefinitionId
| project policyId=policySetDefinitionId, policyName=name,complianceState,pack='N/A', type='Set')
| summarize count() by complianceState,policyName
content.title: Assignment Policies Status

content.query:
insightsresources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionruleassociations"
| extend resourceId=split(id,'/providers/Microsoft.Insights/')[0]
| where isnotnull(properties.dataCollectionRuleId)
| project rulename=tostring(split(properties.dataCollectionRuleId,"/")[8]),resourceName=tostring(split(resourceId,"/")[8]),resourceId//ruleId=properties.dataCollectionRuleId
| join (resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionrules"
| extend MPs=tostring(['tags'].MonitorStarterPacks)
| where isnotempty(MPs) //or properties.dataSources.performanceCounters[0].name == 'VMInsightsPerfCounters'
| summarize by Pack=MPs,rulename=tostring(name)) on rulename
| project-away rulename,rulename1,resourceId
| summarize Associated=count() by Pack
| sort by Pack asc
content.title: Servers/Pack (Association)

content.query:
insightsresources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionruleassociations"
| extend resourceId=split(id,'/providers/Microsoft.Insights/')[0]
| where isnotnull(properties.dataCollectionRuleId)
| project rulename=tostring(split(properties.dataCollectionRuleId,"/")[8]),resourceName=tostring(split(resourceId,"/")[8]),resourceId//ruleId=properties.dataCollectionRuleId
| join (resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionrules"
| extend MPs=tostring(['tags'].MonitorStarterPacks)
| where isnotempty(MPs) //or properties.dataSources.performanceCounters[0].name == 'VMInsightsPerfCounters'
| summarize by Pack=MPs,rulename=tostring(name)) on rulename
| project-away rulename,rulename1,resourceId
| summarize Tagged=count() by Pack
| sort by Pack asc
content.title: Tagged Resources per Tag

content.query:
insightsresources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionruleassociations"
| extend resourceId=split(id,'/providers/Microsoft.Insights/')[0]
| where isnotnull(properties.dataCollectionRuleId)
| project rulename=tostring(split(properties.dataCollectionRuleId,"/")[8]),resourceName=tostring(split(resourceId,"/")[8]),resourceId//ruleId=properties.dataCollectionRuleId
| join (resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionrules"
| extend MPs=tostring(['tags'].MonitorStarterPacks)
| where isnotempty(MPs) //or properties.dataSources.performanceCounters[0].name == 'VMInsightsPerfCounters'
| summarize by Pack=MPs,rulename=tostring(name)) on rulename
| project-away rulename,rulename1,resourceId
| summarize Associated=count() by Pack
| sort by Pack asc
content.title: Associated Servers per Pack

content.json:
## Active Alerts List

This tab shows all Monitoring Packs related alerts that are currently active.

content.query:
alertsmanagementresources
| where ['type'] == 'microsoft.alertsmanagement/alerts'
| project ['Alert Id']=id,resourceId=properties.context.context.resourceId, alertRule=tolower(tostring(properties.essentials.alertRule)), status=properties.context.status,severity=properties.context.context.severity
| where isnotempty(alertRule)
| join (resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/scheduledqueryrules" or type =="microsoft.insights/metricalerts" or type == 'microsoft.insights/activitylogalerts'
| where isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)
| extend alertRule=tolower(tostring(['id']))) on alertRule
| project id, ['Alert Name']=name,['Details']=['Alert Id'], Status=status, Resource=resourceId, Sev=severity
| where Status=='Activated'
content.title: Active Alerts

content.query:
alertsmanagementresources
| where ['type'] == 'microsoft.alertsmanagement/alerts'
| project ['Alert Id']=id,resourceId=properties.context.context.resourceId, alertRule=tolower(tostring(properties.essentials.alertRule)), status=properties.context.status
| where isnotempty(alertRule)
| join (resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/scheduledqueryrules" or type =="microsoft.insights/metricalerts" or type == 'microsoft.insights/activitylogalerts'
| where isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)
| extend alertRule=tolower(tostring(['id']))) on alertRule
| summarize count() by AlertType=type

resources
| where tolower(type) in ("microsoft.insights/metricalerts")
| where isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)
| project nameSpace=tolower(strcat(tostring(split(properties.scopes[0],"/")[-3]),"/",tostring(split(properties.scopes[0],"/")[-2]))),Target=split(properties.scopes[0],"/")[-1]
| union (resources
| where tolower(type) in ("microsoft.insights/activitylogalerts")

| distinct tostring(Target),nameSpace
| summarize Total=count() by nameSpace

{"version":"Merge/1.0","merges":[{"id":"3d65009c-120d-4954-aa36-dd1e33b4b1d8","mergeType":"innerunique","leftTable":"queryServiceTags","rightTable":"query - resourcestomerge - nonIaaS","leftColumn":"nameSpace","rightColumn":"nameSpace"}],"projectRename":[{"originalName":"[queryServiceTags].tag","mergedName":"tag","fromId":"3d65009c-120d-4954-aa36-dd1e33b4b1d8"},{"originalName":"[queryServiceTags].type","mergedName":"type","fromId":"3d65009c-120d-4954-aa36-dd1e33b4b1d8"},{"originalName":"[query - resourcestomerge - nonIaaS].Total","mergedName":"Total","fromId":"3d65009c-120d-4954-aa36-dd1e33b4b1d8"},{"originalName":"[query - 18].type"},{"originalName":"[query - pass - resourcestomerge].type"},{"originalName":"[queryServiceTags].tag"},{"originalName":"[query - resourcestomerge - nonIaaS].nameSpace"},{"originalName":"[queryServiceTags].nameSpace"}]}
content.title: Monitored Services

content.json:
## Server Monitoring Setup

Select servers on the right to assign a pack. Once the backend is done with the assigning, the server will show on the left side grid.

On the left side grid, the monitoring can be updated to add more packs, as well as to remove a specific pack or remove any monitoring altogether from the server.
When Monitoring is first enabled, the Azure Monitoring Agent will also be installed to the selected servers.

content.query:
insightsresources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionruleassociations"
| extend resourceId=split(id,'/providers/Microsoft.Insights/')[0]
| where isnotnull(properties.dataCollectionRuleId)
| project rulename=tostring(split(properties.dataCollectionRuleId,"/")[8]),resourceName=tostring(split(resourceId,"/")[8]),resourceId=tostring(resourceId)//ruleId=properties.dataCollectionRuleId
| join kind= inner  (
resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionrules"
| extend MPs=tostring(['tags'].MonitorStarterPacks)
| where isnotempty(MPs) //or properties.dataSources.performanceCounters[0].name == 'VMInsightsPerfCounters'
| summarize by Pack=MPs,rulename=tostring(name)) on rulename
| summarize by resourceId, Pack
| summarize Packs=make_list(Pack) by resourceId

resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines' 
| where isnotempty(tolower(tags.MonitorStarterPacks))
| project Resource=id,['Resource Group']=resourceGroup,Packs=tags.MonitorStarterPacks, OS=properties.osType, subscriptionId, Location=location
| union (resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines' 
| where isnotempty(tolower(tags.MonitorStarterPacks))
| project Resource=id,['Resource Group']=resourceGroup,Packs=tags.MonitorStarterPacks, OS=properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType, subscriptionId, Location=location)
| join kind= leftouter   (resourcecontainers
| where type =~ 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
| project Subscription=name,subscriptionId) on subscriptionId
| project-away subscriptionId, subscriptionId1

{"version":"Merge/1.0","merges":[{"id":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c","mergeType":"outer","leftTable":"query - taggedVMs","rightTable":"query - associatedVMs","leftColumn":"Resource","rightColumn":"resourceId"}],"projectRename":[{"originalName":"[query - taggedVMs].Resource","mergedName":"Resource","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - taggedVMs].Resource Group","mergedName":"Resource Group","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - taggedVMs].Packs","mergedName":"Packs","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - taggedVMs].OS","mergedName":"OS","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - taggedVMs].Location","mergedName":"Location","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - taggedVMs].Subscription","mergedName":"Subscription","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - associatedVMs].Packs","mergedName":"Associated","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - associatedVMs].resourceId","mergedName":"resourceId","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"}]}
content.title: Monitored Machines

parameters.name: PackTagsLeft
parameters.label: Add/Remove
parameters.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionrules"
| where isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacks) and tags.MonitoringPackType=='IaaS'
| project MPs=tostring(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)
| summarize by MPs

armActionContext.title: Remove Monitoring
armActionContext.description:
# Please confirm the change.

Remove Monitoring for {PackTagsLeft} Pack(s) 

Servers:

{taggedVMs}

armActionContext.title: Add Monitoring
armActionContext.description:
# Please confirm the change.

Add Monitoring for {PackTagsLeft} Pack(s)

armActionContext.title: Remove All Monitoring
armActionContext.description:
# Please confirm the change.

Remove All Monitoring for {PackTagsLeft} Pack(s)

content.query:
resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines' | where isempty(tolower(tags.MonitorStarterPacks))
| project Resource=id,['Resource Group']=resourceGroup, OS=properties.osType, subscriptionId, Location=location
| union (resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines' 
| where isempty(tolower(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)) 
| project Resource=id,['Resource Group']=resourceGroup, OS=properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType, subscriptionId, Location=location)
| join kind= leftouter  (
    resourcecontainers| where type =~ 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
    | project Subscription=name,subscriptionId
    ) 
on subscriptionId| project-away subscriptionId, subscriptionId1
content.title: Non-monitored Machines

parameters.name: PackTags
parameters.label: Select Pack to Enable
parameters.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionrules"
| where isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacks) and tags.MonitoringPackType=='IaaS'
| project MPs=tostring(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)
| summarize by MPs

armActionContext.title: Enable Monitoring Packs

content.json:
## Services Monitoring Setup

Select service on the right to assign a pack. Once the backend is done with the assigning, the service will show on the left side grid.

On the left side grid, the monitoring can be updated to remove a specific pack from the service.

content.json:
## Alerts Configuration

### Select a pack on the left to visualize the alerts rules related to those packs. Select the Other Alerts tab to visualiza any other alert rule that is not related to the packs.

parameters.name: AlertPack
parameters.query:
resources
| where tolower(type) in ("microsoft.insights/scheduledqueryrules", "microsoft.insights/metricalerts","microsoft.insights/activitylogalerts")
| where isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)
| project MPs=tostring(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)
| summarize by MPs

content.query:
resources
| where tolower(type) in ("microsoft.insights/scheduledqueryrules")
| where isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)
| project id,MP=tags.MonitorStarterPacks, Enabled=properties.enabled, Description=properties.description, ['Action Group']=split(properties.actions.actionGroups[0],"/")[8], location, Target=split(properties.scopes[0],"/")[-1]
| union (
resources
| where tolower(type) in ("microsoft.insights/metricalerts")
| where isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)
| project id,MP=tags.MonitorStarterPacks, Enabled=properties.enabled, Description=properties.description, ['Action Group']=split(properties.actions[0].actionGroupId,"/")[8], location, Target=split(properties.scopes[0],"/")[-1])
| union (resources
| where tolower(type) in ("microsoft.insights/activitylogalerts")
| where isnotempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)
| project id,MP=tags.MonitorStarterPacks, Enabled=properties.enabled, Description=properties.description, ['Action Group']=split(properties.actions.actionGroups[0].actionGroupId,"/")[8], location, Target=split(properties.scopes[0],"/")[-1])
| where MP=='{AlertPack}'

content.json:
# Enable or Disable alerts. 

## By selecting a list of alerts on the left, the buttons will disable or enable the alert rules in Azure Monitor.

# Update Action Group
## Select a list of alerts on the left and a new Action Group to assign to the alert.

# Delete Alert rules
## Select a list of alert rules to be deleted.

content.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/actiongroups"
| where properties.enabled == 'true'
| project id, emailReceivers=strcat(properties.emailReceivers[0].name,"(",properties.emailReceivers[0].emailAddress,")")

armActionContext.title: Enable Alerts
armActionContext.description:
# This action will Enable the selected Alerts

{alertsselected}

armActionContext.title: Disable Alerts
armActionContext.description:
# This action will disable the selected Alerts

{alertsselected}

armActionContext.title: Update Action Group
Delete

content.query:
resources
| where tolower(type) in ("microsoft.insights/scheduledqueryrules")
| where isempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)
| project id,Enabled=properties.enabled, Description=properties.description, ['Action Group']=split(properties.actions.actionGroups[0],"/")[8], location, Target=split(properties.scopes[0],"/")[-1]
| union (
resources
| where tolower(type) in ("microsoft.insights/metricalerts")
| where isempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)
| project id, Enabled=properties.enabled, Description=properties.description, ['Action Group']=split(properties.actions[0].actionGroupId,"/")[8], location, Target=split(properties.scopes[0],"/")[-1])
| union (resources
| where tolower(type) in ("microsoft.insights/activitylogalerts")
| where isempty(tags.MonitorStarterPacks)
| project id,Enabled=properties.enabled, Description=properties.description, ['Action Group']=split(properties.actions.actionGroups[0].actionGroupId,"/")[8], location, Target=split(properties.scopes[0],"/")[-1])

content.json:
# Enable or Disable alerts. 

## By selecting a list of alerts on the left, the buttons will disable or enable the alert rules in Azure Monitor.

# Update Action Group
## Select a list of alerts on the left and a new Action Group to assign to the alert.

resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/actiongroups"
| where properties.enabled == 'true'
| project id, emailReceivers=strcat(properties.emailReceivers[0].name,"(",properties.emailReceivers[0].emailAddress,")")

armActionContext.title: Enable Alerts
armActionContext.description:
# This action will Enable the selected Alerts

{alertsselected}

armActionContext.title: Disable Alerts
armActionContext.description:
# This action will disable the selected Alerts

{alertsselected}

armActionContext.title: Update Action Group
Delete
armActionContext.description:
# Deleting the following Alert rules:


{alertsselectednopack}]

content.query:
resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionrules"
| extend MPs=tostring(['tags'].MonitorStarterPacks)
| where isnotempty(MPs) //or properties.dataSources.performanceCounters[0].name == 'VMInsightsPerfCounters'
| summarize by Pack=MPs,rulename=tostring(name)
| join (insightsresources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionruleassociations"
| extend resourceId=split(id,'/providers/Microsoft.Insights/')[0]
| where isnotnull(properties.dataCollectionRuleId)
| project rulename=tostring(split(properties.dataCollectionRuleId,"/")[8]),resourceName=tostring(split(resourceId,"/")[8]),resourceId//ruleId=properties.dataCollectionRuleId
) on rulename
| project-away rulename1,resourceId
| summarize Associated=count() by Pack, rulename
| order by Pack asc
content.title: Select Pack to see associated Machines

content.query:
insightsresources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionruleassociations"
| extend resourceId=split(id,'/providers/Microsoft.Insights/')[0]
| where isnotnull(properties.dataCollectionRuleId)
| project rulename=split(properties.dataCollectionRuleId,"/")[8],resourceName=split(resourceId,"/")[8],resourceId//ruleId=properties.dataCollectionRuleId
| where '{selectedRule}'==rulename
content.title: Associated Machines

resources

| project id,Type=kind, location,syslog=ds.syslog[0].streams[0], windowsEventLogs=ds.windowsEventLogs[0].streams[0], logsettings=ds.logFiles, performanceCounters=ds.performanceCounters[0].streams[0],provisioningState=properties.provisioningState, 
dataCollectionEndpointId=properties.dataCollectionEndpointId,transformKql=properties.dataFlows[0].transformKql,workspaceResourceId=properties.destinations.logAnalytics[0].workspaceResourceId

content.json:
## Policy Management - Compliance

This dialog allows to verify the status of the pack policies as well as Remediate the policies.

A background process remediates policies that are not compliant every 6 hours as well.

content.query:
policyresources | where type == "microsoft.policyinsights/policystates" | extend policyName=tostring(properties.policyDefinitionName), complianceState=properties.complianceState
| join (policyresources | where type == "microsoft.authorization/policydefinitions" and isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks) | project policyId=id, policyName=name, pack=tostring(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)) on policyName
| project policyId, policyName, complianceState=tostring(complianceState), pack,type='Policy'
| union( policyresources
| where type =~ 'Microsoft.PolicyInsights/PolicyStates'
| extend complianceState = tostring(properties.complianceState)
| extend
	resourceId = tostring(properties.resourceId),
	policyAssignmentId = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentId),
	policyAssignmentScope = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentScope),
	policyAssignmentName = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentName),
	policyDefinitionId = tostring(properties.policyDefinitionId),
    policySetDefinitionId=tostring(properties.policySetDefinitionId),
	policyDefinitionReferenceId = tostring(properties.policyDefinitionReferenceId),
	stateWeight = iff(complianceState == 'NonCompliant', int(300), iff(complianceState == 'Compliant', int(200), iff(complianceState == 'Conflict', int(100), iff(complianceState == 'Exempt', int(50), int(0)))))
| summarize max(stateWeight) by resourceId, policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| summarize counts = count() by policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, max_stateWeight, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| summarize overallStateWeight = max(max_stateWeight),
nonCompliantCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 300),
compliantCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 200),
conflictCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 100),
exemptCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 50) by policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| extend totalResources = todouble(nonCompliantCount + compliantCount + conflictCount + exemptCount)
| extend compliancePercentage = iff(totalResources == 0, todouble(100), 100 * todouble(compliantCount + exemptCount) / totalResources)
| project policyAssignmentName, scope = policyAssignmentScope,policySetDefinitionId,
complianceState = iff(overallStateWeight == 300, 'nonCompliant', iff(overallStateWeight == 200, 'Compliant', iff(overallStateWeight == 100, 'conflict', iff(overallStateWeight == 50, 'exempt', 'notstarted')))),
compliancePercentage,
compliantCount,
nonCompliantCount,
conflictCount,
exemptCount
| where isnotempty(policySetDefinitionId)
| join (policyresources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.authorization/policysetdefinitions' and isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)
| extend policySetDefinitionId=tostring(id)) on policySetDefinitionId
| project policyId=policySetDefinitionId, policyName=name,complianceState,pack='N/A', type='Set')
content.title: Assignment Status (Compliance)

armActionContext.title: Remediate a policy
armActionContext.description:
# Remediate

Policies:

[{policyToRemediate}]

armActionContext.title: Remediate policies
Check Policy Compliance
armActionContext.description: # Please confirm the scan.

content.json:
## Policy Compliance Check
This task will trigger a tenant wide check for policy compliance.

## Policy Remediation

This Task will trigger remediation for the policies in the list that are considered not compliant at this time.

## Installed Policies and Initiatives with Assignments

This grid can be used to visualize the policies and currenct assignments as well as assing/unassign policies to/from different scopes.

Once one or more policies are selected, the diaglog of scopes (subscriptions and management groups) is displayed along with the respective buttons.

content.query:
policyresources
| where type == "microsoft.authorization/policydefinitions"
| where  isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)
| project Name=name, Type='Policy',['id'],Pack=tostring(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)
| join kind = leftouter (policyresources
| where type == "microsoft.authorization/policyassignments"
| project AssignmentName=name,scope=properties.scope,PolicyId=tostring(properties.policyDefinitionId), PolicyName=split(properties.PolicyId,"/")[8]
| join kind=leftouter  (policyresources
| where type == "microsoft.authorization/policydefinitions"
| where  isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)) on $left.PolicyId == $right.id
| project tostring(AssignmentName),Name=tostring(split(PolicyId,"/")[8]), PolicyId,ScopeLevel=iff(scope contains 'subscriptions',"Sub", "MG"), Scope=scope) on Name
| project-away Name1, id
| union ( policyresources
| where type == "microsoft.authorization/policysetdefinitions"
| where  isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)
| project Name=name, Type='Initiative',['id'],Pack="_N/A"
| join kind = leftouter (policyresources
| where type == "microsoft.authorization/policyassignments"
| project AssignmentName=name,scope=properties.scope,PolicyId=tostring(properties.policyDefinitionId), PolicyName=split(properties.PolicyId,"/")[8]
| join kind=leftouter  (policyresources
| where type == "microsoft.authorization/policysetdefinitions"
| where  isnotempty(properties.metadata.MonitorStarterPacks)) on $left.PolicyId == $right.id
| project tostring(AssignmentName),Name=tostring(split(PolicyId,"/")[8]), PolicyId, ScopeLevel=iff(scope contains 'subscriptions',"Sub", "MG"),Scope=scope) on Name
| project-away Name1, id)
| sort by Pack asc, AssignmentName asc
content.title: Installed Policies and Initiatives with Assignments

content.json: Select Scope below to assign a policy. There is no need to Select a scope to Unassign the policy.

content.query:
resourcecontainers
| where type == 'microsoft.management/managementgroups' or type =~ 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
| project name, id, subscriptionId, type=split(type,'/')[1]

armActionContext.title: Assign Policy
Unassign Policies

content.query:
Resources
| where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines'
| extend
    JoinID = toupper(id),
    OSType = tostring(properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType)
| join kind=leftouter(
    Resources
    | where ( type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions') and name in ('AzureMonitorLinuxAgent', 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent')
    | extend
        State= tolower(properties.provisioningState),
        VMId = toupper(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions'))),
        ExtensionName = name
) on $left.JoinID == $right.VMId
| union (Resources
| where type == 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend
    JoinID = toupper(id),
    OSType = tostring(properties.osType)
| join kind=leftouter(
    Resources
    | where type == 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions' and name in ('AzureMonitorLinuxAgent', 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent')
    | extend
        State= tolower(properties.provisioningState),
        VMId = toupper(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions'))),
        ExtensionName = name
) on $left.JoinID == $right.VMId)
| summarize by id, OSType, ExtensionName=iff(isempty(ExtensionName),'N/A',ExtensionName), State,subscriptionId,['Resource Group']=resourceGroup, location
| extend Install=iff(ExtensionName=='N/A','Install',iff(State<> 'succeeded','Unhealthy','')), Uninstall=iff((ExtensionName<>'N/A') and (State == 'succeeded'),'Uninstall',iff(State <> 'succeeded','Warning',''))
| join kind= leftouter   (resourcecontainers
| where type =~ 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
| project Subscription=name,subscriptionId) on subscriptionId
| project-away subscriptionId, subscriptionId1
| order by id
content.title: Agent Install Status

{vmstoinstall}

content.query:
Resources
| where type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines'
| extend
    JoinID = toupper(id),
    OSName = tostring(properties.osProfile.computerName),
    OSType = tostring(properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType)
| join kind=leftouter(
    Resources
    | where ( type == 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines/extensions') and name in ('AzureMonitorLinuxAgent', 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent')
    | extend
        VMId = toupper(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions'))),
        ExtensionName = name
) on $left.JoinID == $right.VMId
| union (Resources
| where type == 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines'
| extend
    JoinID = toupper(id),
    OSName = tostring(properties.osProfile.computerName),
    OSType = tostring(properties.osType)
| join kind=leftouter(
    Resources
    | where type == 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions' and name in ('AzureMonitorLinuxAgent', 'AzureMonitorWindowsAgent')
    | extend
        VMId = toupper(substring(id, 0, indexof(id, '/extensions'))),
        ExtensionName = name
) on $left.JoinID == $right.VMId)
| summarize count() by ExtensionName
content.title: Agent Install Status

content.query:
Heartbeat | where Category == "Azure Monitor Agent"
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by Computer
| project  Computer,LastHeartbeat=TimeGenerated, ['SecondsAgo']=datetime_diff('second',now(),TimeGenerated)
| sort by SecondsAgo asc
content.title: Last Heartbeat (24 hours)

content.query:
let windowsApps = datatable(Tag:string, name:string)
[
   "ADDS", "AD-Domain-Services",
   "DNS", "DNS",
   "FS", "FS-FileServer",
   "IIS", "Web-Server",
   "STSVC", "Storage-Services",
   "Nginx", "nginx-core"
];
Discovery_CL
| extend Computer=tostring(split(_ResourceId,'/')[8])//,timestamp=todatetime(timestamp)
| extend fields=split(RawData,",")
| extend timestamp=todatetime(fields[0])
| extend type=tostring(fields[1])
| extend platform=tostring(fields[2])
| extend name=tostring(fields[3])
| extend othertype=tostring(fields[4])
| extend vendor=tostring(fields[5])
| project timestamp,Computer,type,name,platform,othertype,vendor
| join kind=inner (windowsApps) on name
| summarize arg_max(timestamp,Computer) by name, Tag
content.title: Discovered Applications

content.json: When Discovery is first enabled, the Azure Monitoring Agent will also be installed to the selected servers along with a VM Application agent to collect discovery data. Data will be sent to the Log Analytics agent.

content.query:
insightsresources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionruleassociations"
| extend resourceId=split(id,'/providers/Microsoft.Insights/')[0]
| where isnotnull(properties.dataCollectionRuleId)
| project rulename=tostring(split(properties.dataCollectionRuleId,"/")[8]),resourceName=tostring(split(resourceId,"/")[8]),resourceId=tostring(resourceId)//ruleId=properties.dataCollectionRuleId
| join kind= inner  (
resources
| where type == "microsoft.insights/datacollectionrules"
| extend MPs=tostring(['tags'].MonitorStarterPacks)
| where isnotempty(MPs) and (MPs =~ 'WinDisc' or MPs =~ 'LxDisc')//or properties.dataSources.performanceCounters[0].name == 'VMInsightsPerfCounters'
| summarize by Pack=MPs,rulename=tostring(name)) on rulename
| summarize by resourceId, Pack
| summarize Packs=make_list(Pack) by resourceId

resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines' 
| extend MPs=tostring(['tags'].MonitorStarterPacks)
| where isnotempty(MPs) and (MPs contains 'WinDisc' or MPs contains 'LxDisc')
| project Resource=id,['Resource Group']=resourceGroup,Packs=tags.MonitorStarterPacks, OS=properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType, subscriptionId, Location=location
| join kind= leftouter   (resourcecontainers
| where type =~ 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
| project Subscription=name,subscriptionId) on subscriptionId
| project-away subscriptionId, subscriptionId1

{"version":"Merge/1.0","merges":[{"id":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c","mergeType":"outer","leftTable":"query - taggedVMs","rightTable":"query - associatedVMs","leftColumn":"Resource","rightColumn":"resourceId"}],"projectRename":[{"originalName":"[query - taggedVMs].Resource","mergedName":"Resource","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - taggedVMs].Resource Group","mergedName":"Resource Group","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - taggedVMs].Packs","mergedName":"Packs","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - taggedVMs].OS","mergedName":"OS","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - taggedVMs].Location","mergedName":"Location","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - taggedVMs].Subscription","mergedName":"Subscription","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - associatedVMs].Packs","mergedName":"Associated","fromId":"964f21b6-ee11-43c6-a6e2-4119d566812c"},{"originalName":"[query - associatedVMs].resourceId"}]}

content.query:
policyresources | where type == "microsoft.policyinsights/policystates" | extend policyName=tostring(properties.policyDefinitionName),complianceState=properties.complianceState
| join 
    (policyresources | where type == "microsoft.authorization/policydefinitions" and properties.metadata.MonitoringPackType == 'Discovery'  
        | project policyId=id, policyName=name) 
        on policyName
| project Name=policyName, State=tostring(complianceState), type='Policy',policyId
| union( policyresources
| where type =~ 'Microsoft.PolicyInsights/PolicyStates'
| extend complianceState = tostring(properties.complianceState)
| extend
	resourceId = tostring(properties.resourceId),
	policyAssignmentId = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentId),
	policyAssignmentScope = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentScope),
	policyAssignmentName = tostring(properties.policyAssignmentName),
	policyDefinitionId = tostring(properties.policyDefinitionId),
    policySetDefinitionId=tostring(properties.policySetDefinitionId),
	policyDefinitionReferenceId = tostring(properties.policyDefinitionReferenceId),
	stateWeight = iff(complianceState == 'NonCompliant', int(300), iff(complianceState == 'Compliant', int(200), iff(complianceState == 'Conflict', int(100), iff(complianceState == 'Exempt', int(50), int(0)))))
| summarize max(stateWeight) by resourceId, policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| summarize counts = count() by policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, max_stateWeight, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| summarize overallStateWeight = max(max_stateWeight),
nonCompliantCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 300),
compliantCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 200),
conflictCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 100),
exemptCount = sumif(counts, max_stateWeight == 50) by policyAssignmentId, policyAssignmentScope, policyAssignmentName,policySetDefinitionId
| extend totalResources = todouble(nonCompliantCount + compliantCount + conflictCount + exemptCount)
| extend compliancePercentage = iff(totalResources == 0, todouble(100), 100 * todouble(compliantCount + exemptCount) / totalResources)
| project policyAssignmentName, scope = policyAssignmentScope,policySetDefinitionId,
complianceState = iff(overallStateWeight == 300, 'nonCompliant', iff(overallStateWeight == 200, 'Compliant', iff(overallStateWeight == 100, 'conflict', iff(overallStateWeight == 50, 'exempt', 'notstarted')))),
compliancePercentage,
compliantCount,
nonCompliantCount,
conflictCount,
exemptCount
| where isnotempty(policySetDefinitionId)
| join (policyresources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.authorization/policysetdefinitions' and properties.metadata.MonitoringPackType=='Discovery'
| extend policySetDefinitionId=tostring(id)) on policySetDefinitionId
| project Name=name,State=complianceState, type='Set',policyId=policySetDefinitionId)
content.title: Assignment Status (Compliance) - Discovery

armActionContext.title: Rmediate policies
armActionContext.description:
# Please confirm remediation

This button will trigger a global policy remeadiation. 

The backend script will go through the policies and initiatives, finding the ones that are not compliant, and will trigger remediation. 

It is not restricted to the ones in this screen.

armActionContext.title: Check Policy Compliance
armActionContext.description: # Please confirm the scan.

content.json:
## Policy Compliance Check
This task will trigger a tenant wide check for policy compliance.

## Policy Remediation

This Task will trigger remediation for the policies in the list that are considered not compliant at this time.

parameters.name: Computer

Discovery_CL
| parse RawData with timestamp "," rest1
| extend Computer=split(_ResourceId,'/')[8],timestamp=todatetime(timestamp)
| summarize by tostring(Computer)
parameters.label: Select Server

content.query:
Discovery_CL
| extend Computer=split(_ResourceId,'/')[8]//,timestamp=todatetime(timestamp)
| extend fields=split(RawData,",")
| extend timestamp=todatetime(fields[0])
| extend type=tostring(fields[1])
| extend platform=tostring(fields[2])
| extend name=tostring(fields[3])
| extend othertype=tostring(fields[4])
| extend vendor=tostring(fields[5])
//| where Computer == 'server2'
| project Computer,type,name,platform,othertype,vendor
| where Computer == '{Computer}'
content.title: All Discovery Data

content.query:
resources
| where type =~ "microsoft.compute/virtualmachines"
| mvexpand with_itemindex=i apps=properties.applicationProfile.galleryApplications
| where apps != ''
| project Computer=name, ['Application Name']=tostring(split(apps.packageReferenceId,"/")[10]), Gallery=tostring(split(apps.packageReferenceId,"/")[8])
| summarize by Gallery,['Application Name'], Computer
| sort by Gallery asc
content.title: Client Status (VM Applications)

content.query:
resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines' 
| where isnotempty(tolower(tags.MonitorStarterPacks))
| project Resource=id,['Resource Group']=resourceGroup,Packs=tags.MonitorStarterPacks, OS=properties.osType, subscriptionId, Location=location
| union (resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.compute/virtualmachines' 
| where isnotempty(tolower(tags.MonitorStarterPacks))
| project Resource=id,['Resource Group']=resourceGroup,Packs=tags.MonitorStarterPacks, OS=properties.storageProfile.osDisk.osType, subscriptionId, Location=location)
| join kind= leftouter   (resourcecontainers
| where type =~ 'microsoft.resources/subscriptions'
| project Subscription=name,subscriptionId) on subscriptionId
| project-away subscriptionId, subscriptionId1
content.title: Monitored Machines (old)

parameters.name: FunctionApp
parameters.label: Function App
parameters.query:
requests
| project
    timestamp,
    id,
    operation_Name,
    success,
    resultCode,
    duration,
    operation_Id,
    cloud_RoleName,
    invocationId=customDimensions['InvocationId']
| order by timestamp desc
| take 20
| summarize by Functions=operation_Name

content.query:
requests
| project
    timestamp,
    id,
    operation_Name,
    success,
    resultCode,
    duration,
    operation_Id,
    cloud_RoleName,
    invocationId=customDimensions['InvocationId']
| where operation_Name =~ '{FunctionApp}'
| order by timestamp desc
| take 20
content.title: Invocations

content.query:
union traces
| union exceptions
| where operation_Id == '{operationid}'
| where customDimensions['InvocationId'] == '{invocationid}'
| order by timestamp asc
| project
    timestamp,
    message = iff(message != '', message, iff(innermostMessage != '', innermostMessage, customDimensions.[strcat('prop__{','OriginalFormat}')])),
    logLevel = customDimensions.['LogLevel']
content.title: Invocation Details
